pageContext.claim: “Numerous states introducing Bible Literacy classes, giving students the option of studying the Bible. Starting to make a turn back? Great!”
pageContext.analysis: Religious texts may be studied as literature in public schools under longstanding U.S. law, but not as religious doctrine. The legislation Trump was referring to "has drawn objections from groups seeking to protect the separation of church and state. The groups argue that the bills are backdoor attempts to promote Christianity in public schools," The Post reported.
